org.eclipse.papyrus.robotml.deployment

Class StUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.papyrus.robotml.deployment.StUtils

  • public class StUtils
extends Object
    Some functions around stereotype usage. TODO: originally developed without use of static profile. It thus contains many functions that are no longer needed (e.g. getBoolean) => needs some cleanup
    Author:
    ansgar

      • getAttribute

        public static Object getAttribute(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element element,
                                  String stereo_name,
                                  String attrib_name)
        Return the attribute of a stereotype. If the attribute type is a model reference, use the function getAttributeBase instead.
        Parameters:
        element - the element which holds the stereotype
        stereo_name - the name of the stereotype
        attrib_name - the name of an attribute of this stereotype
        Returns:
        The value that is associated with the stereotype attribute

        attrib_name - the name of an attribute of this stereotype
        value - the value that is associated with the stereotype attribute

      • getApplication

        public static org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject getApplication(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element element,
                                                           String stereo_name)
        Return the stereotype application. Like getApplication below, except that the passed stereotype is a string.
        Parameters:
        element -
        stereo_name - the qualified name of a stereotype. Applications of compatible sub-types will be returned as well (if exact stereotype is not applied)
        Returns:

      • getApplication

        public static <T extends org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject> T getApplication(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element element,
                                                                         Class<T> clazz)
        Return the stereotype application by passing an element of the static profile
        Parameters:
        element - the UML model element
        clazz - the class of an element of a static profile. Compatible sub-types will be returned as well
        Returns:
        the stereotype application (first compatible with passed clazz) or null

      • apply

        public static org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Stereotype apply(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element element,
                                                    String stereo_name)
        Apply a stereotype. The stereotype is not applied, if already a sub-stereotype is applied. If you want to apply the new stereotype also in this case, use applyExact instead.
        Parameters:
        element - the element
        stereo_name - the stereotype name
        Returns:

      • unapply

        public static void unapply(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element element,
                           String stereo_name)
        unapply a stereotype when the name of the stereotype is given.
        Parameters:
        element - the element
        stereo_name - the stereotype name

      • applyApp

        public static <T extends org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject> T applyApp(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element element,
                                                                   Class<T> clazz)
        Apply a stereotype and return the stereotype application (if successful). The stereotype is not applied, if already a sub-stereotype is applied. If you want to apply the new stereotype also in this case, use applyExact instead.
        Parameters:
        element - the element
        stereo_name - the stereotype name
        Returns:

      • applyExact

        public static org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Stereotype applyExact(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element element,
                                                         String stereo_name)
        Parameters:
        element -
        stereo_name -
        Returns:

      • apply

        public static org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Stereotype apply(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element element,
                                                    Class<? extends org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject> clazz)
        Apply a stereotype. Caveat: the function relies on the correspondence between the fully qualified stereotype name and the package name within the static profile. The latter may use a different prefix (as it is the case with the MARTE analysis & design profile).
        Parameters:
        element - the element
        class - a class of a static profile
        Returns:

      • unapply

        public static void unapply(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element element,
                           Class<? extends org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject> clazz)
        Unapply a stereotype. Caveat: the function relies on the correspondence between the fully qualified stereotype name and the package name within the static profile. The latter may use a different prefix (as it is the case with the MARTE analysis & design profile).
        Parameters:
        element - the element
        stereo_name - the stereotype name

      • getAttributeBase

        public static org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element getAttributeBase(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element element,
                                                            String stereo_name,
                                                            String attrib_name)
        This function should be used if stereotype attributes are in turn typed by stereotyped elements and the user wants to retrieve the underlying base elements (instead of the stereotype application) The function applies the getBaseElement operation to the result of the getStereotypeAttribute function above.
        Parameters:
        element - the element while holds the stereotype
        stereo_name - the name of the stereotype
        attrib_name - the name of an attribute of this stereotype
        Returns:
        The value that is associated with the stereotype attribute

                                   org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element source,
                                   org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element destination)
        Copy the stereotype application from a source to a destination element. The function will also copy the stereotype attributes.
        Parameters:
        source -
        destination -

      • getStereoName

        public static String getStereoName(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element element,
                                   Class<? extends org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject> clazz)
        Get the stereotype-name that may relate to the name of an interface within a static profile. Note that the class name within a static profile might have a prefix, such as org.eclipse.papyrus. This functions tries to remove prefixes iteratively, if a stereotype is not applicable.
        Parameters:
        clazz -
        Returns:
